greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A triangle of coefficients based on A000045 and Pascal's triangle: t(n,m)=Fibonacci[(n - m + 1)]*Fibonacci[(m + 1)]*Binomial[n, m].
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..120 of table, flattened
Peter McCalla, Asamoah Nkwanta, Catalan and Motzkin Integral Representations, arXiv:1901.07092 [math.NT], 2019.
Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
formula: T(n,k) = A058071(n,k) * A007318(n,k), k = 0..n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 15 2013
mathematica: Clear[t, n, m] t[n_, m_] := Fibonacci[(n - m + 1)]*Fibonacci[(m + 1)]*Binomial[n, m]; Table[Table[t[n, m], {m, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}]; Flatten[%]
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 24 2008
